monogr.title: Three godly treatises : 1. To comfort the sicke. 2. Against the feare of death. 3. Of the resurrection. Written in French by Mr. I.D. L'Espine, Peacher of the word of God in Angeers. And translated into English by S. Veghelman
monogr.author: L'Espine, Jean de

q.p: Take physicke before sicknesse, and examine thy selfe before iudgment, and thou shalt finde pardon in the presence of God.
If thou doest not watch, I will come vnto thee as a theefe, and thou shalt not know at what houre I will come vnto thee.
Happy is hee that watcheth, and keepeth his garments, to the end that hee walke not naked, and that his shame bee not seene.
Bee ready, for the sonne of man will come in an houre that you thinke not.

div.head: To the faithfull Reader, Health.
div.p:
FRiendly Reader, take in good part this present comfort, the which I haue here written for the good and profit of euery one that hath the feare of God, to make vse of it at his neede, when it shall please the Lord to call him; But be aduertised (that thou maist vse it well) that these three letters B.S.N. the first signifieth, brother to a man, the second sister to a woman, and the third, that you must name the partie by their proper name. For it ought not to be honoured with names of worldly honour and dignity, but to oppose it selfe against Satan
in the name of the Lord, it ought to be named by the proper name which it receiued at the holy Sacrament of Baptisme. Which doing thou shalt obey vnto God, whom I beseech to be fauourable vnto thee, at the day of his comming. ({inverted ⁂})
